item.description:
It's the first Sunday in June, time for the annual AIDS Walk Boston! C'mon down, stretch your legs a little, get a little bit of an endorphin rush & a nice glow on your cheeks.
And if that rush/glow happens to result from checking out other walkers' legs in their shorts, well I ain't gonna complain....

We do have an official team - "Boston Tall Singles" - Check out our Web Page
To join the team you need to register as an individual walker first and then choose your team. Use the link from my personal page to join our AIDS Walk Team.

So.... get yourself outta bed in time to meet up with the group @ 9am at the Arlington T-Stop (cnr. of Boylston & Arlington, outside the church). Bring friends with you - the more the merrier! - and they don't have to walk with us if they don't want to/are too hungover to go the distance.

At 9.15am we'll stroll down to the Hatch Shell, hand in our paperwork & limber up for the start of the walk @ 10am.

We'll spend an hour or two walking the 6 mile loop from the Hatch Shell thru the Back Bay, over the Charles River, allong Memorial Drive and then back over the River down to the Hatch Shell.
Sample the freebie ice-creams that Starbucks & Ben+Jerry's always hand out and then go find a cold beer somewhere.
I'm thinking we should head to "Sevens" on Charles Street (nice casual neighborhood pub).
First round of beers courtesy of your team leader. You're drinking on your own tab thereafter.
item.how_to_find_us: *** Meet up at the Arlington T-Stop at 9am and then walk to the Hatch Shell ***
item.name: AIDS Walk Boston 2009
